許.definition: to allow; to permit; to promise; to praise; somewhat; perhaps

許下願心.definition: to express a wish (to a deity)

許久.definition: for a long time; for ages

許仲琳.definition: Xu Zhonglin or Chen Zhonglin 陳仲琳|陈仲琳[Chen2 Zhong4 lin2] (c. 1567-c. 1620), Ming novelist, to whom the fantasy novel Investiture of the Gods 封神演義|封神演义[Feng1 shen2 Yan3 yi4] is attributed, together with Lu Xixing 陸西星|陆西星[Lu4 Xi1 xing1]

許地山.definition: Xu Dishan (1893-1941), journalist, publisher and novelist

許婚.definition: to become engaged; to affiance (a daughter)

許慎.definition: Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]

許旺細胞.definition: Schwann cell (support axon of nerve cell); neurolemmocyte

許昌.definition: see 許昌市|许昌市[Xu3chang1 Shi4]

許昌市.definition: Xuchang, prefecture-level city in Henan Province 河南省[He2nan2 Sheng3]

許海峰.definition: Xu Haifeng (1957-), PRC sharpshooter, 50m pistol gold medalist at Los Angeles 1984 Olympics

許配.definition: to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)

許願.definition: to make a wish; to make a vow; to promise a reward
